Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

DqqNQADYLhAkxM7_fOc74A.text: Ruth's Chris Steak House never fails to deliver-- its also right by the ice rink and Christmas tree so you can check that out while waiting for a table! Service is incredible. Waitress was super attentive. I was super thrilled to head downtown for a break from the hustle and bustle for a night of steak, beers, whiskey, lobster mac and cheese, and potatos of some form.   I have given up red meat as a result of a recent health-care related scare, so I opted for the lobster mac and cheese, and a side of the potatos au gratin to bring home for a friend to sample. My friend's (lets call him Sam) rib-eye was cooked perfectly (medium rare) and my friend Zeke who is vegan (I don't know why we invited him) ordered the Seared Ahi Tuna. I tried some of this and it was some of the best Seared Ahi Tuna I have ever eaten. It came sitting atop a bed of colorful veggies! Idk what veggies they were but damn sis. They were thicc!   The night was going great.  My only complaint, is that the potatos that I was so excited about, were unfortunately burned while the staff was making them in the kitchen. My friend Zeke and I had some really pressing plans afterward and we had already waited a long time for the food, so waiting for more potatos was not an option. I opted to remove the potatos from the check. I was so thankful that I wasn't charged for the burned potatos. Thank you to the entire staff of Ruth's Chris, especially the waitress who removed the potatos from the check!  If anybody knows how good the potatos from Ruth's Chris Steak House taste, please let me know so I can update this yelp review to make it more accurate to the culinary/food quality element of Ruth's Chris... Thanks in advance and thanks again to the staff at Ruths Chris---

xKrTm02sq7GVQXhlZnITlw.text: So we have decided that we would try and make all of our Dinner Dates around the 5:15- 5:30 PM so afterward we could walk around etc. and dinner would complete our entire day! So here we are at Ruth Chris an ancient Restaurant when it comes to elite Steak Restuarant's in Pittsburgh! I'm thinking they have been here over 25 years Downtown! So how do they stack up against the New Steak Restaurants like the Capital Grill, Eddie Merlot's, Morton's, Eddie V's etc. Their Steak "The reason why you came" is a 3.4/4 Star - it was juicy, lean, flavorful with Character and priced within reason! Their sides were the weakness! So much attention to the Steak the supporting cast was slightly less than stellar! The decor was bright with enough room between seating that a conversation could take place without disturbing the next table! The Service with staff was Great although a stench of cigarette smoke could be noticed from a Gentleman clearing our table! Our Drinks were OK but nothing refreshing or talking about! We enjoyed the Dinner and would come again and that's the most important part of a consumer is.... would you do it again!

photos.caption: Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Mac and Cheese
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Fried Calamari

J1roT9mPBbcFZ-ei7BBLfg.text: 1st time visitor for a celebratory meal. Staff was truly awesome and helpful in every aspect. Ordered surf and turf which tasted very well made, cooked perfectly. Also had a ribeye which was cooked perfectly also had a bit of extra fat on it. The sides were the disappointment compared to the entrees. Brussel sprouts were overdone and quite greasy. Loaded baked potato was big but nothing to write home about. The atmosphere was very nice . Creme Brulee desert was average for the level of place they are trying to portray. Cocktail was well made. Pricey of course but you already know that is what you are going to deal with.

2K3keQbxaoyCHlwZEaBjvw.text: This was a sub-par experience. We were surrounded by unset dirty tables. The potatoes , asparagus, and corn Chile tasted off. I was not impressed and rather regretful that I didn't just go to the Outback Steakhouse.

zZybUGWMHIqLyYa3MSdsig.text: I visited Ruth's Chris for a second time. Upon entering the restaurant, I was greeted. My husband and I were seated at a table right near a wall, but I am slender enough to fit in the chair between the table and wall. The waitress and all of the other people who served us were courteous and brought out our food promptly. We enjoyed our appetizers of lobster bisque, which contained lobster meat and was one of the tastiest that I have had in my life, and a caesar salad. Our entrees of filet mignon and sea bass were cooked perfectly. Our sides of asparagus and french fries tasted good. Finally, we ate desserts of cherry cobbler, which seemed to have sparse and dry cherries, and creme brulee, which had a nice hard sugary topping and berries on the side.

C2dbvboVBfS-UetK_P8UCw.text: Bit pricey but so worth every penny! Recommend going at least once.  Steak is out of this world. And the blue crab cakes were really good!

photos.caption: Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Best steak ever! Worth the price paid! Wonderful atmosphere!

j5wTtXz5ZYnn38R5_R5QpQ.text: Went to Ruth's for New Year's Eve dinner with a couple friends.  I had been there about a year ago for my birthday, and there are definitely things to compare.  First of all, the food was good, but not as spectacular as I remember.  That might be just because our overall experience was not as lustrous as last time, or maybe it just wasn't as perfect.  We had the calamari for an appetizer.  It was good, but a little overdone.  It had gone into the rubbery texture everyone wants to avoid.  I had a petit filet, cooked at medium rare.  Could have used a little more seasoning.  Also, I asked if I had to order the full dipping trio to get the truffle butter -- I only wanted the truffle butter -- and she said unfortunately yes.  That was fine, but the other two sauces were then wasted.  In a high end steakhouse, you should be able to order exactly what you want.  My boyfriend had a ribeye cooked to medium, and he has no complaints that I know of.  We shared the lobster mac & cheese, which was really good.  People don't rave about it on other reviews, but we both really enjoyed it.  I also had a coconut ginger lemon drop -- awesome!  Tasted like vacation!  But didn't hold up well flavor wise as it got warm.  No dessert for us, just coffee for me.  My main complaint for the evening, and why I only gave 4/5 stars was the service.  It started out really, really well, but once it was time to actually have food come out, it was like we never saw our server ever again.  Took forever to get the check at the end, and then forever to get the credit card back.  The last time we were there, the service was impeccable.    I do want to say, though, that their renovation is beautiful.  It looked like a completely different place, and we almost walked right by it.  Much more modern and open than before.

Yr7DWVEtlxh_ugAsMvvSCw.text: The best service & food! Can't go wrong here. Cannot wait to visit here again and other locations! HIGHLY RECOMMEND

photos.caption: Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

VE65uaO6JJkiT48dv8urKw.text: Wait until dark! Always my favorite Resturant.  Still great food. "The wait I until" remark was because our reservations  was at 5:30 and it was still light outside.  This Pittsburgh location needed a little lower light.  The carpet was worn and faded and looked 100 years old.  In the evening light all the wood work looked dusty and in need of a do over. I also missed the placing of the napkin on your lap and the constant water filling attention you used to received. Price was the same but this Ruth's Chris experience was not up to expectations ! Oh, and my wife never received her dessert from the "special" Sad!

hmZZaXlrfRq-f7XvSTB1Zg.text: Very big price tags but for the good food, great cocktails, and super attentive waitstaff, you're getting what you pay for.  Visited for the first time with my husband to celebrate my birthday. We had a reservation that was close to the opening time so when we first got there the place was empty. By the time we were taking our check the place was packed.  We ordered a ton of food. We started off with the seared Ahi tuna appetizer and cocktails. He had the kumato tomato salad and the New York strip with a dipping sauce trio and mashed potatoes. I had the ribeye with a bleu cheese crust, lobster tail, and roasted Brussel sprouts. We topped everything off with a creme brulee and a molten lava cake.  The sauce with the tuna was spicy and refreshing and I can't place what was on the cucumber salad that came with it but it was a delightful palette cleanser. The cocktails were strong and fabulous. My ribeye was so tender I didn't even have to use a knife and my lobster was ridiculously fluffy. The Brussel sprouts and cake weren't overly memorable, I probably wouldn't get them again on a revisit.  The food was delicious and the portions are very generous but don't be fooled, you're paying for "a classy experience," being treated like royalty. The waitstaff was very well trained, professional, and conscientious of every detail.  Once the wallet has some time to heal, we'd love to visit again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Molten lava cake with fresh berries and a chilled chocolate mousse. Happy birthday to me!
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Ribeye with bleu cheese crust, lobster tail, Brussel sprouts with bacon, mashed potatoes.

mMmuWFmwnjPfbzFc6U84nA.text: Had an utterly disappointing experience here a few weeks ago. My group of 3 each ordered steaks that none of were able to finish because they were so disgusting. The cuts of meat were terrible and none of the 3 steaks were cooked properly.  Overpriced and not at all what I've come to expect from this type of establishment. Many better options for a good steak or meal in Pittsburgh.

irxvC-b_uMMN3MeFRlh29A.text: Went for lunch with my niece and her husband.  Just as we were served water and bread(delicious)  he was called back to work.  Service was excellent and they prepared his steak at the exact time for us to take it back to him at work. He said it was delicious.  I had crab cakes and expected them to be better but shouldn't I have just ordered a steak?  I also ordered a Pinot Grigio,( Margherita)which I know cost 18 dollars a bottle for which they charged $17/glass.  All the same, it was an enjoyable experience and except for the wine I felt that the the prices were very reasonable.  I would just be more careful about what I order.  It really is a lovely place

5j2WZuYHaQ0cOU_SAWVbCg.text: First time for me.  The calamari was very good. My Ribeye was overcooked dry and bland. Her filet was very undercooked and bland.  We both ordered medium-rare, mine had no color at all and hers was cold and purple. Salt and pepper helped the flavor.  What restaurant in the world does not salt a steak before cooking?  The baked potato was good. The brussel sprouts were OK.  Not even close to worth $200.

y8JqKgpBrs1kHTvD7Fm5Fw.text: Loved the food and service. Steak was cooked perfectly. One of the best in Pittsburgh.  They had a special where i got filet and shrimp with a salad and dessert for $45!!! Unheard of !!  I will come here again

BzyeWWnrW_x_hUvZ85TwhA.text: My fiance booked reservations here for my 30th birthday and we were not impressed. The food was not bad but not good either. I order the 11oz filet well done and it came out still red inside and I had to send it back. When I asked the waiter to cook it longer he said, "well how do you want this to look?" I said, "well done means no red or pink and it's red inside." We also sent the potatoes au gratin back because they were actually cold as if they didn't cook them enough. They say the plates are all 500 degrees but they forgot about the potatoes? We also got the lobster Mac and cheese which was not worth the $21. It was honestly just regular macaroni elbow noodles and watery cheese sauce with lobster just put on top. I looked forward to this meal for a week and was sadly so disappointed and we will not be back because of everything that happened. This place is extremely expensive for steaks and family style sides for it not to be good. However, some good things I would say is the wait staff and they also brought out a complimentary birthday cheesecake and ice cream for us that was delicious and my favorite part of the meal.    My fiance got the bone in New York strip and he ordered it medium and it came out well done no pink. He added the shrimp and it was delicious. He also got the Caesar salad with anchovies and the croutons on top were so good but my fiance needed more dressing it was too dry for him.

photos.caption: Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 11oz filet Oscar style
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Lobster Mac and cheese
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Caesar Salad

2XcwP5pnAA7OKI5v_HFYzQ.text: My wife and I recently visited this location to celebrate her 30th birthday! This used to be a regular spot for us at least once a year but we haven't been for a couple years.  Parking: They provide validation for the parking garage that is directly next door. Very convenient!  Reservations: Made online a few weeks prior to the big day. Also very simple but I'm certain they would take walk ups as well.  Service: They provide incredible service! The great thing about this restaurant is that they have people constantly circulating through the floor.  Food: Delicious! My wife's steak was a bit more rare than medium but it was still very tasty.  We would recommend a visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 11 oz filet&#39;s with the Southwest Mac &amp; Cheese, asparagus, and Potatoes au Grautin. Incredible!
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Complimentary blue berry cheesecake and ice cream for my wife&#39;s birthday. Nice touch!

HkWOGyJ7e03jib4vU7gwOQ.text: This was a beautiful birthday celebration dinner.  The service was the best. The tuna was fantastic .  I ordered the tomahawk ribeye that was cooked to perfection and the food was hot! What a wonderful event!

6rCNCh0C6giBAzJEm-BPFQ.text: I have to start out by saying I am not a meat eater so that's perhaps if I was, I'd have liked it better.  Semi-fancy atmosphere but I still think a nice pair of jeans with a nice shirt or sweater is appropriate. We had reservations for 630 and arrived on time, however, we still waited 20 min to be seated. Our server was very nice was service was a little slow. They seemed very busy and perhaps a little disorganized getting us waters, bread and salad but this was minor.   It was nice that they split the wedge salad for us in the kitchen since we were sharing it with 3 people. There was no shortage of delicious blue cheese crumbles! I'd skip the bacon next time but it wasn't hard to take off either. My scallops were cooked to perfection and came with a delicious pesto. Garlic whipped mashed potatoes were also flavorful and delicious. The biggest disappointment was the brussel sprouts. They were quite honestly, terrible! They were still hard, pieces cut way too big and just completely lacked any flavor. I've made better at home which is sad because they aren't difficult to make. They were clearly an afterthought so I'd get a different size. Hopefully some of the other vegetables are better. My husband LOVED his NY Strip steak and said it melted like butter!   Overall, good meal with good atmosphere. Pricey and expected for a steak house. Great location down in PPG place by market square. Would return but best to bring your meat lovers I think!

photos.caption: Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wedge salad
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Filet $48, garlic mashed potatoes
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Bone in NY strip $60

j9rNNymDyljohoSZzFXl4Q.text: Service and food were outstanding! I made a reservation online where I was able to clearly outline a family member's food allergies. A few days before our reservation I called to make sure we were all the same page about food allergies, and we were! Finally the day of our reservation came and again, the staff went through their notes on our listed allergens = awesome!  We arrive at the restaurant, and were quickly taken to our table. Our server came over, fully aware of our allergies and guided us through the menu of items we could have. (Chef reviewed the items previously) Wine for the parents, Shirley temples for the kids. We skipped appetizers and headed straight for dinner and sides, while enjoying some fresh warm bread. Our kids split a petite filet, I enjoyed the Cowboy Ribeye, and my husband had the New York Strip.  Each steak was perfectly cooked to each of our likings with minimal seasonings (salt and pepper) and served on 500 degree HOT plates. I LOVED the potatoes au gratin with all its cheesy goodness. One child preferred the fries, while the other preferred the au gratin potatoes. Finally, the steamed broccoli was a big miss mostly due to the size of the pieces and it was barely cooked/hard to cut and eat.   While we were pretty full, we felt we could sneak in a bit of dessert. Again, our server walked us through the items that would be safe for us to eat. We split some creme brulee and a triple chocolate mousse. Again, some enjoyed the brulee, others enjoyed the mousse. Neither was a bad choice really! The creme brulee had a nice crunch on top along with some fresh berries. The triple chocolate mousse was again....delicious.   If you're looking for a delicious and fancy steak dinner with with all the fixins in Pittsburgh, this is your place!

photos.caption: Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Creme brulee
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Triple chocolate mousse
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Shoestring fries

1q2yyBomi9615_0g81q6CQ.text: Wife, son, daughter and I went to Ruth Christ to celebrate by sons graduation. The service was absolutely outstanding. Waiter came right over and introduced themselves and took drink orders and gave us menus. Drinks came right away and waiter took order immediately. Ruths Chriss was on the crowded side that night but, There was no issues with service at all. I ordered a porterhouse for two to share with my daughter cooked medium rare. We also ordered sides of mashed potatoes and spinach. The bread was delicious and I had a mozzarella and tomato salad which was also really good. The porterhouse was cooked perfectly. The porterhouse was ok better than other places but not the best I have ever had. It was definitely good, But I think I would have the filet Mignon the next time. The place is really nicely laid out and the staff is truly amazing. The food overall was really good, But the service was beyond great. I would go back just for the service alone. Ruth Chris is definitely on the expensive side so expect a pricey meal. The price is defiantly worth it if you want fantastic service and great food. I will definitely go there again.

photos.caption: Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

yt01jejNeAqYoqU0XV7XcQ.text: Excellent steakhouse located downtown Pittsburgh. I have been to this location twice and both times, the service & food were great. This restaurant has been recently renovated and is very nice.  The first time we ate at this Ruth's Chris, it was my first wedding anniversary. The staff treated us like royalty and we got free dessert. The second time, we went with another couple for restaurant week and had a great time.  As for the food, your sides are purchased separately from your main dish and all sides are served family style. The steaks are reasonably priced for the cut of meat you are getting. They basically melt in your mouth! The steaks are cooked perfectly and served on a 500 degree plate. If you get a steak, I recommend paying extra for the Oscar style or blue cheese crusted, both excellent. If you want a baked potato, they are massive and 1 potato can definitely be shared by 2-3 people.  For an appetizer, I recommend the ahi tuna. Ruth's Chris also has a nice wine list and dessert menu.  I would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great steak house with good service and a nice atmosphere!

photos.caption: Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Dirty martini
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Caesar salad. I asked for no croutons
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Creamed spinach

iLxxCbiNqZkJ0t7lo6ujjQ.text: For being the best steakhouse in Pittsburgh---I don't think Ruth Chris's lives up to that name. But otherwise, it's a delightful restaurant with professional service, a large dining area, and of course, your favorite steaks served in the most indulgent way possible.  I started off my night with a calamari, and it was very nice. It wasn't too salty or dry, and the tangy sauce brought an exciting touch to every bite. The squid wasn't the best quality, but given we're in Pittsburgh, I'll give that a bye.  Next was the steaks, and wow, Ruth Chris's really brings a new definition to indulgence. Not only can you get your favorite cuts, but you get all the butter you want, cooked with whatever herbs you like, and finished however you please. It's just amazing, and you smell the buttery nuttiness all throughout the restaurant. I had the porterhouse for two, and of course it was great, and had the chew and temperature I wanted. If only I could get a dry aged steak, I'd be in love instantly.  With that aside, Ruth Chris's really executes steak the way it should be done. Not too much, but with all the extras you want. Speaking of which, I loved the truffle sauce with the steak. There's always a place for truffle, and I was pleasantly surprised with how well it fit with the steak. Another feature I really loved about Ruth Chris's was their wine selection. They had so many great choices, and at a reasonable price too, which I think brings a lot of merit to their sommelier.   I definitely enjoyed my time at Ruth Chris's, and although there was no dry aged, it still fulfilled most of my expectations and impressed me with all of their attention to the more auxiliary aspects of dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Porterhouse for two
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Calamari

YUPD6DH6DNvJiaSkdVw7Dg.text: Excellent! Do the bone in sirloin! Also had the shrimp cocktail and tomato and mozzarella salad which is easily splittable!  Parking garage below restaurant - complimentary just needs validated.  500 degree sizzlin' plates! Creme brulee at the end is spectacular!  Service is good. Overall will come back.

O3Bw4Q7qheLtscuephcARA.text: Mixed review on this one.   On one hand, the service was good and I generally like the place.  On the other, my restaurant week meal was really not great at all.      The biggest problem I had was the sizzling plate.  This plate was so hot that in about 2 seconds, it would take a medium rare bite of steak and turn it into a medium well bite so hot that you couldn't put it into your mouth.  We were served communal sides, which I put on the plate before I realized.  Those also sort of suffered with the excess heat and were hard to eat (any portion of the bite that touched the plate was boiling hot).  I found my 6 oz filet a little gamey and under-seasoned.  The sides were a bit under-seasoned as well.    My boyfriend ordered the salmon oscar (the oscar added $15 to the meal).  He really enjoyed that dish, but had the same commentary about mine.   We both thought the Caesar salad was good.  The little cheesecake and berries dessert had a raw floury background to it.   Overall, it was not a winner of a meal for me.  The boyfriend had better luck.

3giUjwm9wzD16as075hUlQ.text: I recently dined at Ruth's Chris for the first time and loved it. It was a very pleasant experience. The service was on point! My steak was cooked to perfection. All steaks are served on a sizzling 500 degree plate so make sure you don't touch it! My friend got her steak blue cheese crusted which I'll def be doing next time because it was delicious. You purchase your sides separately like any other steak house. Sides are also served family style so they are enough for 2 people to share. I had the creamed spinach and I highly recommend. It was absolutely delicious and paired well with my delicious filet. They have a large variety of sides on the menu so there are plenty to choose from. For an appetizer we had the ahi tuna and it was the perfect choice. Great quality, size and taste. It's served with a small cucumber salad which was a nice surprise and very tasty. Impressive wine list as well as dessert options. Ruth's is conveniently located downtown and offers an upscale vibe. I absolutely recommend for a special night out.

photos.caption: Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Salted caramel cheesecake
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. 6oz filet and creamed spinach side
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Side house salad

iLqiPTf20ZyExj4xBvxV0g.text: Love the place. Great atmosphere, always consistent and excellent food - check out the creme brulee for sure. And the service is spot on. If you love steaks and a first class dining experience - this is the spot.

n-s_coULlCNAvfWDZNNzOA.text: We are huge fans of Ruth's Chris (have visited from MD to HI), its Restaurant Week in Pittsburgh, and our anniversary is this week so the stars aligned for this visit. Started with the stuffed mushrooms, which were good but not mind-blowing, smooth but heavy on the celery.  The romaine wedge salad with its avocado ranch dressing was tasty and their caesar is a solid classic.  For main courses we each opted for the 6oz filet in medium rare and served with bearnaise, crab meat, and asparagus (oscar style) which she loved and was my first time ordering, and while interesting, I'm going back to ordering my filets unfooled-around with. The side dishes of mashed potatoes and creamed spinach were great.  Dessert followed, the chocolate duo cake is phenomenal.  Having visited many locations, I noticed 2 unique things about the Pittsburgh location- it seemed like patrons were dressed more casually, and the food tasted as though more butter was used in the cooking process.

3LV0O6-VXFD4rKBbzosk_Q.text: I made a last minute reservation to this amazing restaurant at the Silver Legacy Casino in Reno, NV for my birthday last weekend.  I got a 5:30pm reservation for dinner which was perfect.  Upon arrival my beautiful booth was decorated with a birthday card and birthday confetti on the table.  Made it extra special for me.  Then, our waitress, Rachel was exceptional in SO many ways.  Not only was she beautiful and smart, but also incredibly knowledgeable about everything on the menu and made excellent suggestions.  The blueberry mojito was incredible; the stuffed mushrooms incredible; the petit filet steak and shrimp delicious; the salad huge and wonderful; the huge baked potato awesome; and my surprise dessert was the perfect end to my meal.  I had a most amazing dinner and had leftovers!  Now that I'm back in San Francisco I have eaten left overs twice (Yep, of course I brought them home from the hotel fridge!).  It was the very best of birthday dinners.  Thank you SO very much!

Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Birthday Dinner, 3-17-19, Reno, NV, Silver Legacy Casino

Md7wAniGlrAEG-Sht2Q7hg.text: I can't believe that I waited all of these years to come here!  The porterhouse steak was out of this world good!  If you're in Downtown Pittsburgh and want a seriously good meal with even better service then I recommend coming here. The whole entire night there was perfection.

hERGu6lfpjYtxiuoHLtoZA.text: So I didn't know what to expect going to this place because I'm not much of a fine diner. But every year for Christmas, my family chooses a nice restaurant to simply eat, drink, and enjoy each other's company during the hectic holidays. My dad had a gift card for Ruth's from when he retired almost 3 years ago, and said he was saving it for a time we could all go. Well, this Christmas was it!  We were seated promptly at our reservation time and all ordered drinks and cocktails. As I opened the menu, the prices were about what I expected based upon what I've heard. Now I like a good steak, but I can also say I feel like I've never really had a bad steak out, so I'm not too picky. I was wondering to myself if paying triple what I'd typically pay for a steak was going to make a difference to me taste-wise, but I was blown away when mine came. I got the 6 oz filet cooked medium with shrimp. I've never eaten a steak without steak sauce or mushrooms or onions, something to add more flavor. This steak was so. Damn. Flavorful. It's obviously a combination of the cooking it in a thousand some degree oven, as the waitress explained to us, and the mass amounts of butter that I'm sure was applied and soaked in  during different times of cooking. Wow. The smell alone was amazing as it wafted around our table. They should make a candle! (That would actually be weird and you'd be salivating at random in your home. ) Every bite was so melt in your mouth good I really couldn't believe it.   Nearly everyone at our table got the Ruth's Chris classic meals, which were priced for either $48 or $55 depending what you got. They all came with either a soup or salad, one side, and dessert. I was really surprised to see these options on the menu, because we were preparing to spend almost double a person of we all ordered a steak and side. This was a great choice to try a little bit of everything on the menu without going overboard in the money department. I got broccolini as my side, with a salad beforehand and the dessert was a mini apple cheesecake tart with ice cream. I really can't express enough how delicious it all was, but especially that perfectly cooked filet.   The staff was great and very attentive while also answering all of our questions since we'd never dined there before. Definitely a great place to go for a special occasion in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Look at the width of that filet!!! And cooked perfectly medium rare.
Photo of Ruths Chris Steak House - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Filet and shrimp.

o-RdbjPEZ2Y6RS9NViYH-A.text: I came here for a lunch with my coworkers to celebrate the holidays. We made a reservation for their small private room, which suited our needs perfectly. Our server was excellent and extremely knowledgeable about the menu, and was very friendly. I went with the rose to drink, which was delicious. We started off with the calamari appetizer for the table. This was my first time trying calamari, and I was super nervous, as I am not a big seafood person at all. The calamari was served fried with a sweet & spicy Asian chili sauce. It was honestly delicious. Now, some people who are True calamari fans may have found it to be too fried, with an overpowering sauce, but as someone who doesn't appreciate calamari normally and would hate a more chewy or fishy taste, I found this to be quite delicious. I even went in for seconds! The bread that came before our meal was fresh and very tasty. For my lunch, I went with the 6 oz. filet (medium) and shrimp ($32). Many of my colleagues went with the same thing. We all highly enjoyed it. Personally, I will say that I expected the shrimp to be a little larger in size, but they were still fresh and tasted very good. The filet was the most tender filet I have ever had in my life. It was served on an extremely hot plate and was sizzling at the table when it arrived. The server recommended that you order the steak a little more rare than you normally would, as it will continue to cook on the plate. That advice was very well received from me. It was delicious. I ate the entire thing and was in heaven the whole time. Overall, I was blown away with the meal I received and although this is a more expensive spot, I highly believe it was worth the price we paid. We all had a great time and I would love to come back.

Ri5GGvRsuu13KAfWlHur2Q.text: Ruth's Chris is a 5* steakhouse. Everything is extremely well done, including the greeting, drinks, food, service, and atmosphere. Our dinner tonight was unplanned, although we were looking for a chance to see the remodeled restaurant. We had martinis, tomato mozzarella salad, au gratin potatoes, and small filets. Everything was great. We even overspent our calorie budget and had the bread pudding for desert. We'll return as soon as our checking account recovers.

uvNA_1BEvqPnJKgLi7EqxA.text: Complimentary parking BUT only if you park in the CORRECT garage! And don't mention that to the out of towner when they call to inquire nor apologize when you decline to validate because they did not park in the CORRECT garage. Deduct one star! Anyway, always consistently good filet mignon. We both got the Seasonal Pairings which was $47.95 for salad, 6 oz filet, side & dessert. Filet prepared perfectly rare. Ruth Chris has been the only place that I have ever been able to get a perfectly prepared rare filet. The blue cheese dressing on the salad is phenomenal. If there is a Ruth Chris available when I am traveling, you can be sure I am eating there.

r6lQ0HXrSrSiKz2HKQxvNA.text: We dined here on Father's Day. Surprisingly, a lot of others were also treating the "Dad" in their life to a legendary steak. I had requested a romantic booth not knowing that they didn't have such a thing. But we did get a small table stuck in the corner. While you don't seem to get a lot of privacy, you do get good service and a pretty decent meal.   We started with a with a Crabtini to share. It's lump crab meat tossed in vinaigrette and served with Creole remoulade sauce in a chilled martini glass. Very yummy!   As for our steaks, they were amazing. I had a filet mignon. It was very flavorable and cooked to perfection. This is one of the best steaks that I have ever had. For our sides, we shared a one pound baked potato and asparagus with hollandise. For dessert, we shared a creme brulee with fresh berries. Very delicious. Definitely a very nice special occasion restaurant.

VBb8MZPnkxrlQXOB9EJe3Q.text: Always amazing! My Husband and I frequent Ruth's Chris for almost every special-occasion: birthdays, anniversaries, when we need a great meal; and without fail we leave euphoric.   After almost each bite, we close our eyes to shut-out the sense of sight to focus on the taste and aroma of the garlicky, creaminess of the Remoulade on our salads; the richness of the Pesto on our Sea Scallops; the buttery-goodness of our dry-aged steak; and the salty crunch of our French Fries, which Kathy suggested we dip into Honey-mustard for a fantastic salty-sweet combination.  Friday is a good reason to go... Reservations are calling!

HVPoLdMi8TJBoFsJ6erDbw.text: This place is phenomenal from the moment you walk in the door until the moment you finish your leftovers the day after your dinner.  Let me start with the atmosphere: don't go dressed like a bum because you'll embarrass yourself and everyone else there, but I highly doubt you would be asked to leave based on your attire.  Jeans and a golf shirt is fine, but so is a suit and tie.  The restaurant can accommodate almost any attire.  The drinks are expensive but who cares because the food is in a category near its own towards the top of the proverbial mountain.  I am told that the menu includes entrees besides steak, but I have no foggy idea why anyone would go to this restaurant and not order a cut of its world class, corn-fed beef.  I had the porterhouse and I have serious doubts that I could enjoy a steak more than I did that RC cut.  Our server, Christian, only added to the experience by providing us with a welcomed sense of humor and a knowledge of the different menu options that bordered on scholarly.  Yes, you will pay 3 times more for a steak here than you will at your local chain restaurant, but you will also be eating a steak that tastes at least 5 times better than what you're used to ordering.  Go here.  Go hungry.  You won't be disappointed.

RyzjQJMhe2KTuRlC3Y3vUg.text: Best steak we've ever enjoyed.  Service is impeccable and attentive.  A little pricey but worth every penny spent.  Highly recommended.

vfUmQ2e0Q2_7Dwg6LMbX6Q.text: I love lamb chops! The dinner service was great. Very well presented. We were here for valentine's and we truly enjoyed ourselves. It was romantic :)

cLNkqqDmOxI_MLCoHOO6wQ.text: Usually a Morton's guy but my son wanted this for his BDay & I hadn't tried them yet....very good food, from apps to dessert we were quite satisfied! A couple notes: the lobster bisque was a bit watery but still tasted great...my filet was more medium well than medium...other than these minor issues the food was great! Now I have to mention the reservation issue...I reserved a table online, received confirmation AND a phone call to confirm...OK, done...when we get to the greeter they didn't have our name?!!?! I was told they had us down for the next day...ok, your fault not mine...they sat us down & everything was fine...I even got a cancellation message for the reservation I didn't make??!! Again, minor stuff for what was a great night out!

wG1CV2hmAGM7lj2BHkOHiw.text: Wow.  How far we have fallen.  This place used to be THE best steaks in town.  Went here last night for a friends birthday.  Our bill was over $400.  Tip was $120.  We are all in the business.  What a disappointment.  Mine and my buddies $52 ribeye were med well to well done after ordering it medium.  We don't complain, we just eat it.  The lobster mac had 3 pieces of lobster in it with some melted cheese on top of Kraft Mac noodles.  $22!!!  Really??  Service was OK.  I get it, it was a Tuesday night, but charging this much and not getting anywhere close on delivery is a shame.  We counted 32 covers last night from 730-945 when we left.  With quality and service down I'm not surprised.  With 55 years experience between the four of us in the business and owning 2 establishments in Pittsburgh, we were very dissatisfied.  This is the "service" industry and you missed the mark tonight.  Sorry Ruths Chris, I work Wed-Sat nights and the only time we get to go out is Sun-Tue and if this is the best you have to offer, you need to step up your game even if it is an "off" night.

IJEGbYiHaCYpONFOwml3fw.text: No matter which location I go to, I am never disappointed with Ruth's Chris.  I would live here if I could...  Feeling hungry?  Try the Porterhouse...AWESOME!

jKnlxPnFugk0a14-eUPFsQ.text: My wife and I went here to celebrate an early Valentine's Day.  We rarely eat out at expensive restaurants.  The wine selection was very good.  Like many restaurants, you're paying 3x-4x retail prices.  The service staff was very friendly, as you would expect for a restaurant like this one.  My wife wanted something changed on one of their plates and they seemed particularly inflexible.  I thought it odd considering how much we were paying.  The scallop appetizer was very good.  $15 for three very tasty scallops.  The vegetarian platter was also very good and the petit filet + blackened shrimp was excellent.  I thought the filet was a little crustier on the outside than I like.  It was cooked the way I ordered it: medium rare; I just thought the outside was a little more cooked than I usually like.  No dessert for us.

i1NpcNJD14jWXEcu432VQQ.text: Wonderful service all around. Had a few drinks at the bar before dinner, bartender was great.  Food was your standard chops and fish. Very well prepared and tasty. Also a great wine list - I recommend the 2003 Lascombes if you like Bordeaux.  The location isnt the best (downtown) if you are looking for fun afterward.

qt5qdwMtIlflRWOdA3lSYw.text: I came here for lunch recently and all was excellent. I come here about 4 times a year. When I do go I prepare myself by not eating red meat several days prior to going. On the day of I make sure to eat a normal but smaller breakfast. No bagels as they occupy too much space. I arrive a bit later, I am a bit hungrier and the staff that remains are long time regulars who know me but are also there to earn a living and make my visit worthwhile. I always order a filet, medium with mushrooms. I don't drink when go, the beef is too good to have my senses misdirected. The plate and filet arrive in minutes, the plate is sizzling at 500 degrees, if by chance there is too much red in the meat I cut a piece and sizzle it right there on the plate. I recently tried the salmon on a recommendation from the owner and was wowed how good it was. Panko crumbs and lemon, great stuff.  I always feel they go the extra mile for me but the food and service are always top notch i can assume this is the standard.

IvK10ng6jjpra5wRcF_YOw.text: I took my girlfriend here for our 6 month anniversary dinner for a nice night out. I had been here several times before but she had not. As per past experience it was a very nice experience with a good wait staff, and wonderful food. As usual I managed to devour every bit of my t-bone. When asked ifnwe were going to have dessert we declined as we decided to go to our favorite dessert place. We were pleasantly surprised when our waitress retrned with a plate which had strawberries and whipped cream, and happy anniversary written in chocolate! Needless to say that was quite wonderfully sweet in a few ways! All in all we will be dining here again.

mkYOZuAYJv2hbutG2BuWPA.text: ok I am trying to catch up on my reviews and since coming back from vaca in great SF and I have jetlag with nothing else to at the moment, I am trying to do just that. My husband and I have eaten at RCSH over the years and with each visit the service has gotten increasingly worse! The food is wonderful as always but really with our dinners averaging 200 plus tip I believe the service should be topnotch. What happened RC???? WE LOVE your food but can't justify the prices with service so bad. We should not have to keep looking around for our waiter for a drink refill and we told numerous times we would like bread with our meal and when we brought it up to him, his reply was, "oh the bread is done yet" and no reply about the drinks...sad...too busy talking with the other staff(this did happen last October, before the Yo-yo Ma concert we attended) Hey, maybe they have improved..but ah we are not taking anymore chances with this place!

4Pi8p34kYO0x0UQ1l9jWnA.text: Dinned here last night for my birthday. Absolutely wonderful. Our waitress Erin was the best. Had the Porterhouse for two. Cooked to perfection. Drinks were great. This place lives up to all the hype. Best meal I have ever had. Had the strawberries and creme for desert, they were so sweet and delicious. The management were very nice and accomadating since we arrived about an hour early.  We are looking forward to coming back at New Years Eve.

yRDli_Ue4w9MIKLouyu8dw.text: I was attending an event in the city a few months ago and decided to try Ruth's Chris Steak House.  This was my first time, and I was looking forward to sampling their famous steaks.  We arrived 15 minutes before our reservation, and were seated immediately.  Appetizers were looking good, so we decided on the crab-stuffed mushrooms.  The mushrooms were earthy and seared, with jumbo lump crab meat inside.  They were finished with Romano cheese; tasty.  The Ahi Tuna was next; meaty pieces of fish with fresh ginger- also good.  All of the menu items at Ruth Chris are a la carte.  What that means is:  everything is ordered separately, and priced on an individual basis.  For example if you order a piece of steak, it comes by itself; no veggies or starch.  Watch out here, it can become a costly endeavor if you aren't keeping track!  I ordered the Filet Mignon, and my two dinner companions requested the New York Strip Steaks.  We also requested dinner salads, fresh broccoli (topped with a cheddar cheese sauce!), and the highly recommended sweet potato casserole with pecan crust.  My steak arrived in a casserole dish sizzling in butter.  Yeah, that's right, butter!  I sliced into the piece of meat and was amazed....  The Filet was cooked medium rare; it was a taste explosion in my mouth.  The meat was tender and soft, juicy and salty; by far the best piece of meat I have had in the city.  My dinner-mates were also pleased with their choices.  We tried the salads, they were fresh and crispy.  The broccoli was also good- the best part was the sharp cheese sauce (does this cancel out the nutritional properties of the vegetable?).  Our favorite was the sweet potato casserole; it was sweet, creamy, and the pecans added the perfect texture to the dish.  Our waitress was fun and informative.  She was very well educated in the different cuts of meat, and an excellent saleswoman!  We ended the evening with a warm apple crumb tart and a piece of chocolate sin cake- we finished them in a timely manner.  Ruth's Chris is a great choice if you find yourself in the city looking for dinner.  It's not cheap; you can easily spend $75.00 per person.  If you're willing to spend the cash, you won't find a better steak anywhere. Ruth's Chris Steak House 6 Ppg Place Pittsburgh, PA 15222 (412) 391-4800

LhVww54Bi_fx6Nfq5rOVqA.text: oh. my. god.  the food was absolutely delicious.  service was divine.  ambience was impeccible.  This is seriously the best steak I have ever had in my life.  The sides were equally as delicious.  Plan on spending some serious bucks here.

NGFudlpAongo_Sg5RFemSg.text: I took my parents here because it's one of their favorite places, but I wasn't that impressed.  The service was impeccable, but the food - not much different than Outback or Texas Roadhouse.

BPnVDklKwpDXz2ofSHaIKg.text: Horrible service and the food is not comparable to any other Ruth Chris I have been to and I've been to them in 10-15 different cities. My rib-eye was all fat and the waitress was so snotty we wanted to throw our drinks at her. Save your money, this place doesn't deserve to be named Ruth Chris. I've had better steaks at the Outback Steakhouse!!

Q39qU5FL0gULzQQK6dVXMA.text: The steaks here are very good.  It's the same quality as the other high end places (prime cuts, aged, etc.).  However, I love the fact that they serve them on  platters sizzling with butter.  That's something somewhat unique compared to some of the other shops.  I love the sound of the sizzle as the plates approach the table.  I had dinner a couple of nights ago and while the steaks are top notch the bar isn't that good.  The  bartenders are competent, but the atmosphere is pretty lame.  It's kind of an afterthought it seems.  Oh yeah, and they don't have Guiness on tap.  I'm going to start a petition that  no liquor licenses should be issued without a guarantee that the proprietor have guiness on tap.  I mean, how do you not at a steakhouse?  If you  go here for dinner do your  happy hour elsewhere.  The service is very good.  The crab stuffed mushrooms are okay, but they certainly aren't noteworthy.  The mashed potatoes are great and the asparagus is okay, but I think  at high end steakhouses they should have asparagus that is as big as a baseball bat, something you can't get at the local grocery.  Overall a very fine experience.  I'd rate the chain steakhouses  in this city in this order for sit down dinners Mortons, Capital Grille,  Ruth Chris, Hyde Park.  And, for bar area and bar dining Capital Grille, Hyde Park, Mortons, Ruth Chris.

Lbc4OkK9C98FbVI_ta1UWw.text: This wasn't my first trip to a Ruth's Chris, but my first to this Ruth's Chris. This Ruth's didn't let me down, as it was right up there with every other Ruth's I've been to.  My filet mignon came out cooked perfectly medium rare- and I have to say I've never had that messed up on me at a Ruth's- with the flavor you expect from them. It's one of my favorite steaks with the crumbled bleu cheese coating it.  I had the pleasure of meeting the owner and his wife while I was there, and they seemed like such great people. Their visit definitely made the trip a little more enjoyable.

nCc2bzEnX4dA0eTeRowHNQ.text: First time coming here. I took my husband here for his birthday dinner we loved it! We got appetizers (blackened scallops and stuffed mushrooms) and they both were very good. Our steaks were cooked to perfection and the brussel sprouts were to die for yum yum!!

suZgOwa-W_9Og4o7M4hIqg.text: When it comes to the high-end chain steakhouses, Morton's and Capital Grille are great.  They consistently deliver great steaks and dependable apps, sides, and desserts.  However, my first and forever True love for steaks will always be Ruth's Chris.  I can still remember my first trip there in high school after my buddy's dad took us there to celebrate graduation.  As the 500 degree plate came out with the glorious aroma of perfectly cooked meat sizzling in butter, I knew I was not only in for something special, but a livelong love.  Ruth's Chris is a franchise and the setting in different cities can be quite variable.  The Philadelphia Ruth's Chris is right next to the Academy of Music with gas lamps lighting Broad St.  The Boston's Ruth's Chris is in old city hall with a beautiful ceiling 2 stories up in the bar area.  Pittsburgh's Ruth's Chris cannot boast such extravagance in their setting, but the food is equally outstanding in all their restaurants.  My recent venture to Ruth's Chris was with 4 other young men in a "guys night out."  I brought several bottles of wine (you have to love the PA Chairman's selection) because Ruth's Chris amazingly allows you to do this.  We started with the seared Ahi tuna.  It was raw, thick, and delicious.  Actually, it kind of tasted like steak.  We each went on to get various cuts of meat.  I personally rolled with my favorite:  NY Strip, medium rare (correctly done with a blood red center), extra butter.  The extra butter is key.  If you're going to roll with a decadent feast of steak, might as well pull out all the stops.  It was brought out absolutely perfect and delicious.  The table also shared the excellent huge family-style sides of asparagus and garlic mashed potatoes.  Our server was extremely gracious.  She opened and decanted a couple of our bigger bottles as soon as we sat down to give them time to breathe.  They arranged for us to have a cab-van at the end of our meal to take us to our next location.    If I was really searching for something negative to say, it's that I wish that the Pittsburgh Ruth's Chris was in a more extravagant setting like some bigger cities.  However, since the main menu is exactly the same, Ruth's Chris is forever my go-to location for a perfect steak dinner.

sWzCSLW2tYPG1EFYt1k8hQ.text: Yes, it is a chain, but this location is still my favourite in Pittsburgh. Possibly it has to do with reminiscence. Here I had the first real steak of my life, and finally understood why anything above medium rare is considered butchery. Just watch out for the hot plates.

WM0bWKR86VkY0eFTBNRqfg.text: I wavered between 4 and 5 stars here. If the rating was strictly based on food, I'd go with 5, easily. But, it's based on service, too, which is why I had to knock one off. Here's the deal...  I love Morton's. Its old-school interior and no-gimmicks shtick is awesome. Plus, of course, the food is fantastic. However, I wanted to branch out, and Ruth's Chris had some great reviews, so I utilized Yelp's oh-so-convenient Open Table reservation feature, and scored a table for two on a Saturday night.   Our reservation was for 8:30. We arrived right on the dot, but were told to go to the bar and wait. So, my boyfriend and I both got cocktails -- he had Glenlivet, which is obvs hard to mess up, and I got the Peachy Pear-tini, which was delish. And then, we waited. And waited. Around 9, our table was ready.   Our waitress was Kristen, and she was fantastic. Very attentive, friendly, witty, and knowledgeable about the food. Here's our food rundown:  - Barbequed shrimp app: I initially thought was BBQ sauce + shrimp, but it ain't. It's succulent li'l shrimp in a deliciously garlicky, white wine-infused sauce with a cayenne kick. Kristen suggested that we dip the bread in the sauce after the shrimp were gone, and we happily took her up on that.   -Ruth's chopped salad: Holy crap. The most memorable salad of my life. I rarely rave about salads. In fact, I think this is the first time I ever have in my life. But, this salad was incredible! It has crispy onion strings on top, hearts of palm (which I love), and this amazing lemon-basil dressing, among other delicious things. So awesome.  - Filet mignon: My boyfriend and I both opted for the filet. I got mine with extra butter, he got his with a bleu cheese crust. Mine was phenomenal. The sizzling butter really adds an extra dimension of flavor that puts it beyond Morton's. My boyfriend found the bleu cheese to be a li'l too generous, and he wound up scraping some off, but still enjoyed it.  - Broccoli au gratin: Again, phenomenal. I've never enjoyed broccoli so much. Granted, it was swimming in bubbling, gooey cheese...  - Potatoes lyonnaise: We took a risk here, as many people rave about the garlic mashed potatoes, and we saw mountains of them carried past our table. But, it paid off big-time. These were, hands-down, the BEST lyonnaise potatoes EVER. Pamela's has nothing on these. Every mouthful was a medley of crusty brown potatoes and caramelized onion goodness. I dream about these potatoes.  So, based on that experience, we went back again the next Saturday. Different waitress, same food (literally, we ordered exactly the same items, 'cause they were so damn good). I don't remember the waitress' name that we had the second time, but we waited longer for food to appear, were checked on far less, she took the cocktail shaker with my extra martini in it before I'd gotten to pour it in my glass, our steaks were not done correctly (he got my medium-rare, I got his medium-well), and it took forever to get the check. I really think it ruins the experience when you're done eating and ready to go, and you're just sitting there, drumming your fingers, looking around the dining room and wondering, "Where the hell is the waitress with our check?"   That said, we will definitely be back. We'll just request to be seated in Kristen's section! :)

56jM-PtHCJOW2jdd5aWy2Q.text: Best service every time and the most frictions food I ever had! I find myself going back although it's pricy because the food and service is always amazing! Great place to take ur date!

-OFvPBM7WKo4524gR86d6w.text: You will be surprised. Really not that expensive.  Costs are very fair. Wine prices are unusually attractive, most under $40.00.  What makes Ruth's Chris costly is your ordering drinks, several appetizers, larger steaks than you need, wine, side dishes, dessert and coffee.  The 12 ounce fillet is a meal in itself. If you get a lot of side dishes, by the time you have a little of this, a little of that, your beef is cold.   Don't be cheap, but be realistic.   We were there for the beef. Excellent.   Try Ruth's Chris. You will remember the steak for a long time. That's why you went.   Enjoy!

4oTOmlmqirqCUhHUHOpSrg.text: Really good steaks! The porter house is to die for! Something about cooking a steak in butter! Paula Deen would be proud! The location could be better. With all the new construction of new condos and office buildings going up now would be a great time to move! Was my favorite until Hyde Park came to town. Really good service and drinks!

DrcFjWoKW314Uo59S_tB5A.text: I've been to this Ruth's Chris several times. Often in the winter, we will head in for an early dinner and then skate off the calories at the PPG ice rink across the street.  As long as you make a reservation, seating shouldn't be a problem. I have never had to wait more than five minutes unless I was waiting for someone. If you do have to wait, sit at the bar and order one of their cocktails (Pear Martini and the mojito are excellent.) Extensive wine list.  All of the appetizers are delicious. Favorites include the Ahi Tuna, crabcake, and stuffed mushrooms. But you're going there for the steak, right? Right.   The last time I went, they had a special where two people could have filets and split a lobster. We elected for this option. I ordered my steak medium. It came out sizzling in butter. After overcoming my caveman urges to tuck in to the obviously too-hot-to-eat-yet steak, I instead ate some of the asparagus we ordered as an appetizer.   Important note. At Ruth's Chris, almost all sides are family sized so you can share. Our asparagus was perfectly cooked and was accompanied by a delicious hollandaise.   Finally, we made our way to the steaks. Cooked exactly to order and seared in butter, it was delicious and tender. The lobster was slightly overcooked, but still tasty.   Service is always excellent. Tip well.   Cons. The restaurant is very expensive. I like to go for special occasions or for when they have specials.

GK_hMgWJNaey7gmQRWjPfQ.text: The best restaurant in the burgh..I travel from California and this is my go to place to eat..sweet potato with vanilla ice cream so good

yVHpY9QbC-Lqreg7lghNcA.text: I'm really torn by this review. For years and years this was my favorite restarant in the downtown area. We went there last Saturday for dinner and had what I would deem an average meal at exorbitant prices. The salads, while tasty, were much smaller than I had remembered previously.  The side dishes, again, were seemingly smaller to not only me but our party as well. Unfortunately, the worst part of my meal were the steaks. For $45 I received a New York Strip that was WAY overpriced (my wife makes it all the time and much much better) and was, in a word, chewy. The service overall, was quite good, unless you like a car valet (they don't have it). Next time I'll try Morton's or Capital Grille.

ni1nLgdZ63P5saLk2hKhew.text: Ordered the filet here with a group of friends recently and asked it to be medium rare, came out well done and I mean rubber well done. I didn't want to be the guy out of the group to send it back so I just threw some garlic mashed potatoes (very good but hard to screw up mashed potatoes) to help me get the steak down.  Being downtown, I would easily go to Capital Grille or Morton's a few blocks away if I wanted a steak that was cooked correctly. I have been to both of those establishments multiple times and have never gotten a bad mean, I figured I would switch it up at Ruth Chris' and was very disappointed. Looks like I will be sticking to Capital Grille or Morton's

B9lX8sG9xxWo-jhx_1Noyw.text: This place has mouth watering steaks, unbelievable wine choices and impeccable service. I can not wait to go back.

7TH3uHhCc2p1ANd_qIIizg.text: my fiance and i went here during our parent's get away for dinner on a friday night.  I've been to many a high priced steakhouse, and knew you get what you pay for at most places like these.  however my man, has not.  When he saw the pricing, he was flabbergasted.  i explained (and hoped!!!) he would not be disappointed, in the service, drinks, or food!  Thankfully they proved him wrong.  We decided to share a large steak, which the back waiter cut for us and served on 2 plates, a wedge salad, au gratin potatoes, asparagus with hollandaise and dessert to go.  After a couple of delectable cocktails, he loosened up about how much $ we were blowing, and enjoyed each and every course!  They were very busy, but everything was great.   all in all we specnt about $150 including tip and sharing the steak was a good call bc we left full!

V-QI4s-OO7iNebR9SSIlLg.text: Employees were all working hard very nice and conversational.  My family and I enjoyed celebrating my birthday here over the weekend

m2tHsfZ2FoW-oxmOgt6O_w.text: What can you say about a chain like this? Well, the steaks are quality, and my filet was done Pittsburgh rare just as I asked. All the sides are pretty pedestrian steak-house fare. I will say the veg wasn't overcooked.  The decor needs a makeover big-time. Heavy cafe curtains and shutters cover the windows - closed in to the point that you don't realize half the restaurant is glass! It could just as easily be in a basement. The finishes - oak, printed carpet, banquette upholstery - is just a bit above what was standard in Eat-n-Park just over a decade ago.  These places will always be popular for a certain demographic of diner - but I can't help to think a light re-invention and a little imagination would lift them above Morton's and the like. With all the creative cooking going on in America these days, Ruth's Chris is coasting a bit.  Lunch is better than dinner - the portions are more realistic, and you don't have to have 6 people dining to make use of their family-size side dish portions.

uv3uhFgryTb8i5CVoLTN5g.text: I took my parents out to celebrate the Christmas season.  My mother ordered the petite filet mignon, which she thought was very good.  The sides we ordered - mashed potatoes and creamed spinach, were also good.  However, my father and I shared the porterhouse for two.  For $90, I would have expected a much better piece of meat.  Flavor was good, but It was tough.  There were some pieces which could not be cut by my knife.  In addition, the presentation was poor.  They put a big plate in the center of the table, then cut up the steak into 10 or 12 cubes.  These cubes were then cooked.  I could have done better at home.

atQ14Jmy0EP28rgvqcFP9w.text: Good overall experience, but for the price I'd really like my steak to be perfect. The whole table ordered medium rare but ate a medium steak because the hot plate that the steaks were served on continued cooking the steak

vekpbLcOaIYal8KS_ZcOVg.text: Alot of people wrote spot on positive reviews so i will some it up, they are probably the best steak house in Pittsburgh and that is saying something.  Pittsburgh has many good steakhouses.  Go earlier in the week, if your like me you hate waiting but Ruth's is probably the exception if you dont have a resavation.   Score Food Quality 5 Service 4 Atmosphere 4  Value 4 Recommend 5  Tier 1

GIQ2GGevriv15Wz0UPO1aQ.text: This is the third Ruth Chris I've been to. The steak was delicious as usual, but the service and overall atmosphere was a little off.   The other locations I've visited have been located in casinos and I have to say they are more laid back and comfortable. You didn't feel like you had to whisper to your dinner mates.   The only food complaint I have is that the asparagus was very large and barely warm. But luckily the bread and potatoes were more than enough to go with my steak.   Parking here is free if you can find the lot. There was no mention of the parking online or when I made the reservation. So we paid for parking and had to walk a few blocks.
